body_html:
@gunan, thanks for the response.

To confirm, We will also soon remove all docker containers under tools/ci_build, do you mean stop official support for build inside docker container?
when will this happen?

I believe this is a useful feature to build inside docker.
For example, our CI build machines are shared with other team, so we prefer to build inside docker for isolation.
Maybe we should still keep it, and leave the maintenance work to the community?

tools/docker is not quite friendly for ci build and release scenario.
Also, it lacks of support for multiple python versions, e.g. build whl for python 3.5, python 3.6.

body:
@gunan, thanks for the response.
 
To confirm, `We will also soon remove all docker containers under tools/ci_build`, do you mean stop official support for build inside docker container? 
when will this happen?

I believe this is a useful feature to build inside docker. 
For example, our CI build machines are shared with other team, so we prefer to build inside docker for isolation. 
Maybe we should still keep it, and leave the maintenance work to the community?



`tools/docker` is not quite friendly for ci build and release scenario. 
Also, it lacks of support for multiple python versions, e.g. build whl for python 3.5, python 3.6.
